org.pebble.core.encoding

Class OutputBitStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pebble.core.encoding.OutputBitStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OutputSuccinctStream

    public class OutputBitStream
extends Object
implements Flushable, Closeable
    Output stream that contains useful method to write data at bit level.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OutputBitStream(byte[] buffer)
      Initializes empty output stream associated to buffer.
      OutputBitStream(OutputStream os)
      Initializes empty output stream associated to os.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Flushes buffer content into output stream and closes it.
      void flush()
      Flushes buffer content into output stream and clears buffer content.

      Writes size bits from bytes into output stream.

      Writes 1 when x is true and 0 when x is false.

      Writes delta coding of value x.

      Writes 32 bits binary representation.

      Writes binary representation of the size least significant bits of value x.

      Writes 64 bits binary representation.

      Writes binary representation of the size least significant bits of value x.

    • Method Detail

      • writeDelta

        public int writeDelta(int x)
               throws IOException
        Writes delta coding of value x. For the example value: 5 
             6 Increment one.
     110 Binary representation.
     3-10 Decimal Gamma Prefix and Binary Gamma Suffix.
     11-10 Binary Gamma Prefix and Binary Gamma Suffix.
     01110 Delta Encoding.
        Parameters:
        x - value to be encoded.
        Returns:
        number of written bits.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case there is an exception writing into output stream.

      • writeInt

        public int writeInt(int x,
                    int size)
             throws IOException
        Writes binary representation of the size least significant bits of value x. For example value 1074268235 and size 20 
             10000000100001001011
        Parameters:
        x - value to be encoded.
        size - number of significant bits from x to be written.
        Returns:
        number of written bits.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case there is an exception writing into output stream.

      • writeInt

        public int writeInt(int x)
             throws IOException
        Writes 32 bits binary representation. For example value 1074268235 
             01000000000010000000100001001011
        Parameters:
        x - value to be encoded.
        Returns:
        number of written bits.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case there is an exception writing into output stream.

        public int writeLong(long x,
                     int size)

             100000000000000000000100000000000010000000100001001011
        Parameters:
